The movie stars Mark Ruffalo and Jim Carrey as a couple who have had their relationship turn sour. After undergoing a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories forever, the couple goes on a journey together where they rediscover themselves and their love for each other.
Another movie that could be recommended based on the user's preferences is "What Women Want" (2000) by Alan Arbenz.
The movie stars Mel Gibson and Bette Midler as a cocky, chauvinistic advertising executive named Harry. After magically acquiring the ability to hear what women are thinking, Harry goes on a journey where he meets several different types of women who each have their own unique set of requirements that they expect from any potential partner.
As Harry travels through these different types of women's territories and encounters each one of these women, he begins to understand more about what really constitutes a successful romantic relationship, as well as what it takes for a potential partner to truly and effectively resonate with the specific unique needs and desires of their potential partner.
